name: Coorg River Rafting Experience

tour_location.description:
The Kodagu district of Karnataka is famous for its coffee plantations, lush greenery, picturesque surroundings, rich flora and fauna and the native tribes that inhabit the region. A very popular hill station, Coorg paints a pretty picture of the grandeur of nature. Nestled in the thickly canopied Western Ghats, the district is home to the native speakers of the Kodava language. Coorg is a hilly region where the elevation varies between 3,000 feet and 5,740 feet. The highest point is the peak of the Tadiyandamol which is a popular trekking destination. The second highest point is the Pushpagiri -- another popular trekking destination.

Coorg also has a number of local attraction to its credit. The most prominent amongst them include the tibetan settlement of Bylakuppe, Omkareshwara temple in Madikeri, and the picnic spot of cauvery nisargadhama.

The River Cauvery is the main river of the Coorg district. It is home to several tribal communities including the Airi, Male Kudiya, Thatta, Kembatti etc. The natives of Coorg worship arms and weapons. Their attire is distinctive and quite attractive. The men wear long knee length coats known as Kupyas over full sleeved shirts. A gold coloured sash called Chale is worn over the Kupya and a silver knife called Peechekath is tucked into it. The other items that go with the ensemble include a knife called the Odikathi and a small gun with a dagger hanging from it.

Being a part of the Western Ghats, Coorg is rich in flora and fauna. It has three wildlife sanctuaries – the Talakaveri, Pushpagiri and Brahmagiri Wildlife Sanctuaries- and one national park, the Nagarhole National Park. Some of the animal species found in these wildlife parks include the Asiatic elephant, tigers, leopards and wild boars.

The nearest railheads to Coorg are the Kannur and Mysore railway stations. The nearest airports are the Mysore Airport and the Mangalore International Airport. Madikeri in Coorg is well connected by three Ghat roads.
tour_location.name: Coorg

nearest_metro_city.description:
Bangalore is a city of diversified culture and is capital city of the state of Karnataka. Founded by Kempe Gowda, it is one of the top ten preferred entrepreneurial destinations in the world. Apart from being the IT capital of India, it is also popularly known as the “Silicon valley of India”; offering a pleasant climate throughout the year.

Some of the most popular tourist attractions of Bangalore include Bannerghatta National Park and the Lalbagh botanical gardens. The national park is home to a variety of animals like tigers, bears and elephants. The Lalbagh botanical garden houses more than 1,000 species of flora and a glass house. The other tourist destinations include the Bangalore Fort, Cubbon Park and several temples located in and around the city.

Those who are looking out for some adventurous activities can try their hand at paragliding at Nandi Hills which is located very close to Bangalore. A day outing trip to Savandurga, Anthargange or Ramanagara is also highly recommended for those looking for a bit of offbeat adventurous activities.

Located in Southern India on the Deccan Plateau about 3,020 ft above sea level, Bangalore is strategically located and well-connected to other tourist places of Karnataka by road and rail and various national and international destinations.
nearest_metro_city.name: Bangalore

city.name: Coorg

reviews.content: This was my first rafting experience and man it was amazing. We really had a blast and we wish we could have been here for longer!

We experienced rafting for the first time and it was a truly amazing experience. Coorg is a beautiful place and one of the best hill stations down south for those who love nature! The thrill of river rafting cannot be explained in words! You have to experience it!

Rafting ia a fun experience but at the same time it scared the shit out of me dude! Damn, I though it won't be that tough but IT IS. Anyhow, the place is good, the river provides idyllic conditions for rafting. Great experience.
My first rafting experience ever!! And so well managed by the instructors.
The rafting experience was fun experience. I could feel my heart racing as I fought with the raging tides and waves. Loved the entire experience. Great experience- in loooooveee with it!

this was my first rafting experience as we hit white waters my heart starts to pound faster and i was to nerves but in the end of the day it was a fun filled activity hoping to come back in some time soon.
Loved the entire rafting experience at Coorg. Had an awesome time with my buddies. The place is damn beautiful. Loved the entire experience.
We tried rafting for the first time and it was a truly amazing experience. Coorg is a beautiful place and one of the best hill stations down south for those who love nature!

Thanks Thrillophilia, you guys have an awesome customer support team. Secondly the rafting instructors are really great, they provide you all details, so first timers just leave all worries as these guys will solve all your queries. The place is just so beautiful that you will keep admiring its and wow what a rafting experience. I can still feel my heart beat increasing whenever I look at our pictures. Its much-much better than all the adventure park fun... this is some real adventure that I guess one needs to try at least once.
The thrill of river rafting cannot be explained in words! You have to do it to believe it!

I didn’t even know that river rafting in Coorg was possible until I did this river rafting adventure in Barapole River. All the instructors were extremely helpful and well experienced due to which even if I was scared, I dared to try! You should too!

My experience of river rafting in Coorg was nothing short of magical. As soon as we reached, the beauty and serenity of the Bramhagiri Wildlife Sanctuary overtook my senses! Thereafter, we had a safety briefing which was extremely essential as I had no prior experience of rafting. They told us about rafting safety, what to do when the leader yells a command and things like that. Then the true thrill began! Oh Wow! My stomach was doing backflips and somersaults man! Crazy! I will recommend Barapole rafting to anyone who wants to experience adventure in Coorg.

Great time man!!! It was such an awesome experience. I'm glad all my friends decided to go for this activity together - had a breathtaking experience. There is no better way to spend a weekend than by participating in this extreme level of adventure.

Well at first it might appear a very simple task but trust me guys this will strain your muscles out! I had such an amazing time, we as a group of six members were all first timers but in all the rafting was one hell of a experience. Entire time we were just struggling to synchronize, however, once we got that right, there was nothing stopping us.

Wow, so this was first rafting experience, damn it was awesome. I would highly recommend this trip to all. Make sure you understand every minute instructions as well and the end its just team work...so buck up!

Great place, its just so beautiful that even if you are not participating in rafting you can simply sit and relax your muscles. But I would highly recommend all to go on the rafting spree here as once you are in water you will just not feel like returning to the land... great experience. a must for all!!

This was my first rafting expeirence and it was a truly amazing feeling to go really fast on the rapids like that! We got ample training from experts and there are some amazing rapids here for you to try out!
Amazing experience! Had a lot of fun. It is a must go guys...especially if you had tried rafting before, The tour providers did an excellent job. Kudos!!!

Coorg River Rafting was an incredible experience. I just cannot believe I finally did rafting. Everything is so well maintained and especially the instructors they will guide you through the entire process. Loved it.

Coorg River Rafting was my first rafting experience! Thanks to all my friends and the instructor I finally had the guts to embark on this thrilling adventure. Its a great place even if you are a beginner you will get ample briefing that will help you in successfully completing the activity. Amazing experience.
River rafting Coorg was an exciting experience and seriously much needed for all of us! As a team of office colleagues we know just how much we needed to get out out! :P
Woohoo!! Awesomesauce this rafting was! I did not even know that Bangalore ke itna pass there is rafting. Crazy amounts of fun we had!

vendor.description: Hello there, testing the supplier app
vendor.name: Test Vendor - Mounika

Cancellation Policy: If cancellations are made 15 days before the start date of the trip, no cancellation fees will be applicable.
If cancellations are made within 7-15 days before the start date of the trip, 10% of booking value will be charged as cancellation fees.
If cancellations are made within 3-6 days before the start date of the trip, 25% of booking value will be charged as cancellation fees.
If cancellations are made within 0-2 days before the start date of the trip, 50% of booking value will be charged as cancellation fees.

In case of unforeseen weather conditions or government restrictions, certain activities may be cancelled and in such cases the operator will try his best to provide an alternate feasible activity. However no refund will be provided for the same.
Refund Policy: The applicable refund amount will be processed within 10 business days
Confirmation Policy: The customer receives a confirmation voucher via email within 15 minutes of successful booking.

Advisory: You are advised to change in to T-Shirts, Shorts or Trousers with adequate foot wear like floaters during rafting.
Ladies are not allowed to wear sarees while rafting.
Children below 14 years and  pregnant ladies are not allowed.
Consumption of alcohol or any other intoxicating products is strictly prohibited during this trip.
For safety purposes, do pay heed to the guidelines given by the instructors.

overview:
About the activity: 

  • Rafting in Coorg, through the Barapole River's roaring currents is indeed an experience worth cherishing! The activity begins with your arrival at Barapole. You can participate in this activity of 3 hours anytime between 09:00AM to 03:00PM. Make sure you attend the next session on safety tips to enjoy the best of rafting Coorg! 
  • You will be getting a briefing from experts, followed by a drill and the run that will take you in the river for a distance of 2.5km. The base camp lies near the Ponya Devarakad. You will be entering the first stretch of rapids of rafting in Coorg after 600 meters of paddling from the pool, which is called Morning Coffee, a level 2 range of rapids. 
  • Rafting continues as you progress to the Grass Hopper level 3, more difficult than level 2. The adventure takes a wild turn with Ramba Samba level 2, Wicked Witch level 3 and finally the Big Bang which is of level 4. After this, you will reach base camp to refresh.
